entry.title: The Price of Power
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 126,219Chapters: 21/?Kudos: 17

Summary: Athena Carter and Bobby Nash couldn’t be more different. She’s the disciplined “good girl” with her future mapped out, while he’s the dangerous bad boy with one foot in college and the other in the streets. When their worlds start to collide, what begins as a bitter rivalry quickly sparks into something deeper neither of them can ignore. But falling for Bobby means stepping into a world Athena never imagined, one ruled by loyalty and violence. That tested everything she thought she knew about herself. As sparks turn to fire, Athena must decide if love is worth the risk of losing everything.

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 153,029Chapters: 23/?Kudos: 43

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 135,952Chapters: 23/?Kudos: 16

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: Deep in the Heart of Me
entry.summary:
Author: BekahRose

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,340Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: The nerves that he was feeling before, about being too twitchy and too difficult to work on or with, are replaced with a different type of anxiety. He’d scoured and scoured the internet for months looking for ideas and inspiration after he’d made his decision and in the end, he’d had to roughly sketch something in the hopes of translating the image he saw in his head into something someone else would understand. OR The one where Chris surprises his parents with a tattoo...

entry.title: The Sudden Geography Of Us
entry.summary:
Author: Madforyou

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,952Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 31

Summary: He should’ve gotten in his truck, driven off, and chalked the whole thing up to chance. But the truth is, when Buck (Evan Buckley, though he’d apparently fight God and man to keep anyone from calling him that aside from his older sister he hasn’t spoken to in years) decided to imprint on Eddie like a baby duck, Eddie was done for. A goner. Lost to blue eyes and a physique that apparently could make a straight man re-categorize his entire sexuality in under five minutes. ORDifferent First Meeting AU: Buck and Eddie meet on a hiking trail. Buck doesn't stop rambling and Eddie doesn't interrupt, and before they know it they've spent the whole day together. But what happens when Eddie gets more attached than he intended to?

entry.title: Even the Dead Still Breathe
entry.summary:
Author: BlckOnyx

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 104,402Chapters: 26/26Kudos: 174

Summary: It has been a year since Bobby’s death, and Buck has never been the same. Grief eats at him in quiet ways the rest of the 118 can’t quite reach, so when he announces he’s taking a break and heading abroad, everyone tells themselves he deserves the space. A week later, he disappears. Weeks turn into months, and the people he left behind are forced to believe the unthinkable—that Buck walked away for good. Until the headlines change, and the word “presumed dead” settles over them like ash. What none of them know is that Buck’s story didn’t end there. His grief, his secrets, and the dangerous truth he’s been carrying all lead back to a past no one at the 118 ever imagined. And when the pieces finally surface, the loss they thought they understood becomes something else entirely. How will the 118 deal with losing people they love, only to find out later that it was all a lie? OR Buck disappeared, and the truth might destroy what’s left of the family they built.

entry.title: The beautiful chaos of buddie: A High School sweetheart saga
entry.summary:
Author: anon_user18

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,564Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 6

Summary: Oh Fuck! Oh Fuck! Eddie thinks to himself. His face grows red and nerves start to fill every pore of his body. Of course his lab partner is Buck, of course it is. Eddie is internally panicking, and when he looks up again to prepare himself, Buck is already standing there. “Hi Eddie!” Buck exclaims. Eddie freaking bluescreens at the attractive guy in front of him. “Uhhh- Y-you know my name?” Eddie asks back like an idiot because he is acting like one right now. Buck laughs! * Or the buddie High School Sweethearts fic *

entry.title: Entre o Céu e o Inferno: O Desejo de Buck
entry.summary:
Author: caarmeeem

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,195Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 27

Summary: Evan Buckley was never supposed to be born only as a “savior baby.”What no one knew was that, in their desperation to save Daniel, Phillip and Margaret turned to Lucifer Morningstar. A pact was sealed, but the debt was never paid.Now, years later, Buck carries not only the pain of failing to save his brother, but also the inheritance of a father who doesn’t belong to this world. Raised by Lucifer himself, Buck grows up among angels, demons, and humans, bearing the gift of hearing people’s deepest desires.By his sister Maddie’s side—the only part of the Buckley family who truly loves him—he finds the strength to keep following his own path.When he chooses to become a firefighter, fate intertwines him with Eddie Díaz—a deconstructed Catholic, single father, and the only person capable of making Buck believe that love can be greater than any dark legacy.

entry.title: Of Kidnappings, Cherry Red Suckers, Apocalypse Apologies, & a Giant Bag Full of....
entry.summary:
Author: Firefawn

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,896Chapters: 3/12Kudos: 355

Summary: If Buck thought the aftermath of the lawsuit was bad, it had nothing – absolutely nothing – on the Winchesters barreling into his life, finding out the apocalypse was imminent, that his own death was a seal, and a demon hitting on him.He really should have realized that when an angel shows up to stop you from throwing yourself off a bridge, that it isn’t always a good thing.----After the lawsuit, Buck is back at work, hoping to reconcile. Only...it doesn't go as planned. His family hates him and after a lifetime of rejection it's one hit too many. Buck plans his goodbye…only a certain angel stops him, 'borrows' him, hands him the Winchester-patented starter's guide to hunting manual, and gives him purpose again. Too bad that angel was so busy saving Buck, they forgot about the goodbye letters left in the loft.---Buck rubbed at the bridge of his nose tiredly. "I'm pretty sure this is kidnapping."Dean scoffed. Sam shot him a look "Think of it as adult babysitting."Gabriel waggled a bottle of top shelf bourbon from his perch on the TV stand. "With booze!"Right. Buck eyed his new...friend, warily. "Okay, kidnapping adjacent."

entry.title: Run-Around (Run to Ground)
entry.summary:
Author: WhenTheLastStoneFalls

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,976Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 42

Summary: “Mr. Diaz?” “Yes, yeah, I’m here. Is Buck okay? Where are you calling from? Why didn’t he call me?” “Mr. Buckley is stable. He’s undergoing minor surgery at Centinela Hospital Medical Center in Inglewood at the moment, and will likely be discharged later this evening or tomorrow morning, without any complications. As his emergency contact, will you be able to come to the hospital?” — The boys take different paths to process their grief, and somehow still end up at the same place. Featuring: Undiagnosed ADHD, sensory seeking behavior, bad coping skills, Buck 1.2, Eddie figuring some stuff out and being the one with his shit together (for once), and a scheming Maddie.

entry.title: bashed out
entry.summary:
Author: ProsperDemeter

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 37,360Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 121

Summary: He left, and when he told Maddie she cried and Buck held her until she stopped shaking. He stayed for a dinner he made, and then well past Jee-Yun's bedtime and Chim had told him, seriously, when he was gathering his things and Maddie had fallen asleep on the couch, to do something that should have been simple. "Call Eddie." "Sure," Buck said with a half smile and a bubbling in his gut. He wasn't going to call Eddie. Eddie was busy, and Buck was an adult, and, in the grand scheme of things, his mother dying wasn't anything for anyone to worry about. She was dead, Eddie Diaz could stubbornly restart Buck's heart, but Margaret Buckley was well past the ressusitation point. Eddie was a lot of things (smart, capable, funny, handsome, adorable, so, so, so kind), but he wasn't a necromancer. Besides, what had sent him back to Texas was much more important than Buck dead mother. -- Or a story about grief, and love, and all of the complicated emotions in between.

entry.title: The Ballad of Meth Lab Jim and Susan from the HOA
entry.summary:
Author: allthestarsofneptune

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,008Chapters: 2/5Kudos: 44

Summary: When Eddie's neighbor, Susan, learns of his plan to move to El Paso and sublet to Buck, she's both upset and confused. After all, what could possibly have happened to cause Eddie not just to leave L.A., but to divorce his husband? Susan decides that she must investigate, interviewing the residents of South Bedford Street for any information they might have on what happened to the nice firefighter couple from the end of the cul-de-sac. What she finds shocks her, especially when she realizes that each neighbor seems to have a vastly different understanding of the nature of the relationship between one Mr. Eddie Diaz and one Mr. Evan Buckley.
